00029 from Koo.Rpc import RpcProxy
00030 from Koo import Rpc
00031 from Koo.Common import Options
00032 from Record import Record
00033 import Field

00039 try:
00040         set()

00044 ## @brief The RecordGroup class manages a list of records.
00045 # 
00046 # Provides functions for loading, storing and creating new objects of the same type.
00047 # The 'fields' property stores a dictionary of dictionaries, each of which contains 
00048 # information about a field. This information includes the data type ('type'), its name
00049 # ('name') and other attributes. The 'fieldObjects' property stores the classes responsible
00050 # for managing the values which are finally stored on the 'values' dictionary in the
00051 # Model
00052 #
00053 # The group can also be sorted by any of it's fields. Two sorting methods are provided:
00054 # SortVisibleItems and SortAllItems. SortVisibleItems is usually faster for a small
00055 # number of elements as sorting is handled on the client side, but only those loaded
00056 # are considered in the sorting. SortAllItems, sorts items in the server so all items
00057 # are considered. Although this would cost a lot when there are thousands of items, 
00058 # only some of them are loaded and the rest are loaded on demand.
00059 #
00060 # Note that by default the group will handle (and eventually load) all records that match 
00061 # the conditions imposed by 'domain' and 'filter'. Those are empty by default so creating 
00062 # RecordGroup('res.parnter') and iterating through it's items will return all partners
00063 # in the database. If you want to ensure that the group is kept completely empty, you can
00064 # call setAllowRecordLoading( False ) which is equivalent to calling setFilter() with a filter 
00065 # that no records match, but without the overhead of querying the server.
00066 #
00067 # RecordGroup will emit several kinds of signals on certain events. 
00068 class RecordGroup(QObject):
00069 
00070         SortVisibleItems = 1
00071         SortAllItems = 2
00072 
00073         ## @brief Creates a new RecordGroup object.
00074         # @param resource Name of the model to load. Such as 'res.partner'.
00075         # @param fields Dictionary with the fields to load. This value typically comes from the server.
00076         # @param ids Record identifiers to load in the group.
00077         # @param parent Only used if this RecordGroup serves as a relation to another model. Otherwise it's None.
00078         # @param context Context for RPC calls.
00079         def __init__(self, resource, fields = None, ids=[], parent=None, context={}):
00080                 QObject.__init__(self)
00081                 self.parent = parent
00082                 self._context = context
00083                 self._context.update(Rpc.session.context)
00084                 self.resource = resource
00085                 self.limit = Options.options.get( 'limit', 80 )
00086                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(resource)
00087                 if fields == None:
00088                         self.fields = {}
00089                 else:
00090                         self.fields = fields
00091                 self.fieldObjects = {}
00092                 self.loadFieldObjects( self.fields.keys() )
00093 
00094                 self.records = []
00095                 
00096                 # toBeSorted properties store information each time sort() function
00097                 # is called. If loading of records is not enabled, records won't be
00098                 # loaded but we keep by which field we want information to be sorted
00099                 # so when record loading is enabled again we know how should the sorting
00100                 # be.
00101                 self.toBeSortedField = None
00102                 self.toBeSortedOrder = None
00103 
00104                 self.sortedField = None
00105                 self.sortedOrder = None
00106                 self.updated = False
00107                 self._domain = []
00108                 self._filter = []
00109                 self._allowRecordLoading = True
00110 
00111                 if Options.options['sort_mode'] == 'visible_items':
00112                         self._sortMode = self.SortVisibleItems
00113                 else:
00114                         self._sortMode = self.SortAllItems
00115 
00116                 self.load(ids)
00117                 self.removedRecords = []
00118                 self._onWriteFunction = ''
00119 
00120         def setOnWriteFunction(self, value):
00121                 self._onWriteFunction = value
00122 
00123         def onWriteFunction(self):
00124                 return self._onWriteFunction
00125 
00126         def __del__(self):
00127                 #print "DEL..."
00128                 self.rpc = None
00129                 self.parent = None
00130                 self.resource = None
00131                 self._context = None
00132                 self.fields = None
00133                 for r in self.records:
00134                         if not isinstance(r, Record):
00135                                 continue
00136                         r.__del__()
00137                 self.records = []
00138                 #print "F: ", self.fieldObjects
00139                 for f in self.fieldObjects:
00140                         self.fieldObjects[f].parent = None
00141                         self.fieldObjects[f].setParent( None )
00142                         #self.disconnect( self.fieldObjects[f], None, 0, 0 )
00143                         #self.fieldObjects[f] = None
00144                         #del self.fieldObjects[f]
00145                 #print "DELETE"
00146                 self.fieldObjects = {}
00147 
00148         ## @brief Returns a string with the name of the type of a given field. Such as 'char'.
00149         def fieldType( self, fieldName ):
00150                 if not fieldName in self.fields:
00151                         return None
00152                 return self.fields[fieldName]['type']
00153 
00154         # Creates the entries in 'fieldObjects' for each key of the 'fkeys' list.
00155         def loadFieldObjects(self, fkeys):
00156                 for fname in fkeys:
00157                         fvalue = self.fields[fname]
00158                         fvalue['name'] = fname
00159                         self.fieldObjects[fname] = Field.FieldFactory.create( fvalue['type'], self, fvalue )
00160 
00161         ## @brief Saves all the records. 
00162         #
00163         # Note that there will be one request to the server per modified or 
00164         # created record.
00165         def save(self):
00166                 for record in self.records:
00167                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00168                                 saved = record.save()
00169 
00170         ## @brief Returns a list with all modified records
00171         def modifiedRecords(self):
00172                 modified = []
00173                 for record in self.records:
00174                         if isinstance( record, Record ) and record.isModified():
00175                                 modified.append( record )
00176                 return modified
00177 
00178         ## @brief This function executes the 'onWriteFunction' function in the server.
00179         #
00180         # If there is a 'onWriteFunction' function associated with the model type handled by 
00181         # this record group it will be executed. 'editedId' should provide the 
00182         # id of the just saved record.
00183         #
00184         # This functionality is provided here instead of on the record because
00185         # the remote function might update some other records, and they need to
00186         # be (re)loaded.
00187         def written( self, editedId ):
00188                 if not self._onWriteFunction or not editedId:
00189                         return
00190                 # Execute the onWriteFunction function on the server.
00191                 # It's expected it'll return a list of ids to be loaded or reloaded.
00192                 new_ids = getattr(self.rpc, self._onWriteFunction)( editedId, self.context() )
00193                 record_idx = self.records.index( self.recordById( editedId ) )
00194                 result = False
00195                 indexes = []
00196                 for id in new_ids:
00197                         cont = False
00198                         for m in self.records:
00199                                 if isinstance( m, Record ):
00200                                         if m.id == id:
00201                                                 cont = True
00202                                                 # TODO: Shouldn't we just call cancel() so the record
00203                                                 # is reloaded on demand?
00204                                                 m.reload()
00205                         if cont:
00206                                 continue
00207                         # TODO: Should we reconsider this? Do we need/want to reload. Probably we
00208                         # only want to add the id to the list.
00209                         newmod = Record(id, self, parent=self.parent)
00210                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00211                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00212                         newmod.reload()
00213                         if not result:
00214                                 result = newmod
00215                         newIndex = min(record_idx, len(self.records)-1)
00216                         self.add(newmod, newIndex)
00217                         indexes.append(newIndex)
00218 
00219                 if indexes:
00220                         self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), min(indexes), max(indexes) )
00221                 return result
00222         
00223         ## @brief Creates as many records as len(ids) with the ids[x] as id.
00224         #
00225         # 'ids' needs to be a list of identifiers. The addFields() function
00226         # can be used later to load the necessary fields for each record.
00227         def preload(self, ids):
00228                 if not ids:
00229                         return 
00230                 start = len(self.records)
00231                 # Discard from 'ids' those that are already loaded.
00232                 # If we didn't do that, some records could be repeated if the programmer
00233                 # doesn't verify that, and we'd end up in errors because when records are
00234                 # actually loaded they're only checked against a single appearance of the 
00235                 # id in the list of records.
00236                 #
00237                 # Note we don't use sets to discard ids, because we want to keep the order
00238                 # their order and because it can cause infinite recursion.
00239                 currentIds = self.ids()
00240                 for id in ids:
00241                         if id not in currentIds:
00242                                 self.records.append( id )
00243                 end = len(self.records)-1
00244                 # We consider the group is updated because otherwise calling count() would
00245                 # force an update() which would cause one2many relations to load elements
00246                 # when we only want to know how many are there.
00247                 self.updated = True
00248                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, end )
00249 
00250         ## @brief Adds a list of records as specified by 'values'.
00251         #
00252         # 'values' has to be a list of dictionaries, each of which containing fields
00253         # names -> values. At least key 'id' needs to be in all dictionaries.
00254         def loadFromValues(self, values):
00255                 start = len(self.records)
00256                 for value in values:
00257                         record = Record(value['id'], self, parent=self.parent)
00258                         record.set(value)
00259                         self.records.append(record)
00260                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00261                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00262                 end = len(self.records)-1
00263                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, end )
00264         
00265         ## @brief Loads the list of ids in this group.
00266         def load(self, ids, display=True):
00267                 if not ids:
00268                         return True
00269 
00270                 self.preload( ids )
00271                 return True
00272 
00273         ## @brief Clears the list of records. It doesn't remove them.
00274         def clear(self):
00275                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), 0, len(self.records)-1 )
00276                 self.records = []
00277                 self.removedRecords = []
00278         
00279         ## @brief Returns a copy of the current context
00280         def context(self):
00281                 ctx = {}
00282                 ctx.update(self._context)
00283                 return ctx
00284 
00285         ## @brief Adds a record to the list
00286         def add(self, record, position=-1):
00287                 if not record.group is self:
00288                         fields = {}
00289                         for mf in record.group.fields:
00290                                 fields[record.group.fields[mf]['name']] = record.group.fields[mf]
00291                         self.addFields(fields)
00292                         record.group.addFields(self.fields)
00293                         record.group = self
00294 
00295                 if position==-1:
00296                         self.records.append(record)
00297                 else:
00298                         self.records.insert(position, record)
00299                 record.parent = self.parent
00300                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordChanged)
00301                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00302                 return record
00303 
00304         ## @brief Creates a new record of the same type of the records in the group.
00305         #
00306         # If 'default' is true, the record is filled in with default values. 
00307         # 'domain' and 'context' are only used if default is true.
00308         def create(self, default=True, position=-1, domain=[], context={}):
00309                 self.ensureUpdated()
00310 
00311                 record = Record(None, self, parent=self.parent, new=True)
00312                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordChanged)
00313                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00314                 if default:
00315                         ctx=context.copy()
00316                         ctx.update( self.context() )
00317                         record.fillWithDefaults(domain, ctx)
00318                 self.add( record, position )
00319                 if position == -1:
00320                         start = len(self.records) - 1
00321                 else:
00322                         start = position
00323                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsInserted(int,int)'), start, start )
00324                 return record
00325         
00326         def recordChanged(self, record):
00327                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordChanged(PyQt_PyObject)'), record )
00328 
00329         def recordModified(self, record):
00330                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modified()') )
00331 
00332         ## @brief Removes a record from the record group but not from the server.
00333         #
00334         # If the record doesn't exist it will ignore it silently.
00335         def remove(self, record):
00336                 if not record in self.records:
00337                         return
00338                 idx = self.records.index(record)
00339                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00340                         id = record.id
00341                 else:
00342                         id = record
00343                 if id:
00344                         # Only store removedRecords if they have a valid Id.
00345                         # Otherwise we don't need them because they don't have 
00346                         # to be removed in the server.
00347                         self.removedRecords.append( id )
00348                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00349                         if record.parent:
00350                                 record.parent.modified = True
00351                 self.emit( SIGNAL('modified()') )
00352                 self.emit( SIGNAL('recordsRemoved(int,int)'), idx, idx )
00353                 self.records.remove( record )
00354 
00355         ## @brief Adds the specified fields to the record group
00356         #
00357         # Note that it updates 'fields' and 'fieldObjects' in the group.
00358         # 'fields' is a dict of dicts as typically returned by 
00359         # the server.
00360         def addFields(self, fields):
00361                 to_add = []
00362                 for f in fields.keys():
00363                         if not f in self.fields:
00364                                 self.fields[f] = fields[f]
00365                                 self.fields[f]['name'] = f
00366                                 to_add.append(f)
00367                         else:
00368                                 self.fields[f].update(fields[f])
00369                 self.loadFieldObjects(to_add)
00370                 return to_add
00371 
00372 
00373         ## @brief Ensures all records in the group are loaded.
00374         def ensureAllLoaded(self):
00375                 ids = self.unloadedIds()
00376                 c = Rpc.session.context.copy()
00377                 c.update( self.context() )
00378                 values = self.rpc.read( ids, self.fields.keys(), c )
00379                 if values:
00380                         for v in values:
00381                                 #self.recordById( v['id'] ).set(v, signal=False)
00382                                 r = self.recordById( v['id'] )
00383                                 r.set(v, signal=False)
00384 
00385         ## @brief Returns the list of ids that have not been loaded yet. The list
00386         # won't include new records as those have id 0 or None.
00387         def unloadedIds(self):
00388                 ids = []
00389                 for x in self.records:
00390                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00391                                 if x.id and not x._loaded:
00392                                         ids.append( x.id )
00393                         elif x:
00394                                 ids.append( x )
00395                 return ids
00396 
00397         ## @brief Returns the list of loaded records. The list won't include new records.
00398         def loadedRecords(self):
00399                 records = []
00400                 for x in self.records:
00401                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00402                                 if x.id and x._loaded:
00403                                         records.append( x )
00404                 return records
00405 
00406         ## @brief Returns a list with all ids.
00407         def ids(self):
00408                 ids = []
00409                 for x in self.records:
00410                         if isinstance(x, Record):
00411                                 ids.append( x.id )
00412                         else:
00413                                 ids.append( x )
00414                 return ids
00415 
00416         ## @brief Returns a list with all new records.
00417         def newRecords(self):
00418                 records = []
00419                 for x in self.records:
00420                         if not isinstance(x, Record):
00421                                 continue
00422                         if x.id:
00423                                 continue
00424                         records.append( x )
00425                 return records
00426 
00427         ## @brief Returns the number of records in this group.
00428         def count(self):
00429                 self.ensureUpdated()
00430                 return len(self.records)
00431 
00432         def __iter__(self):
00433                 self.ensureUpdated()
00434                 self.ensureAllLoaded()
00435                 return iter(self.records)
00436 
00437         ## @brief Returns the record with id 'id'. You can use [] instead.
00438         # Note that it will check if the record is loaded and load it if not.
00439         def modelById(self, id):
00440                 record = self.recordById( id )
00441                 if not record:
00442                         return None
00443                 self.ensureModelLoaded( record )
00444                 return record
00445         __getitem__ = modelById
00446 
00447         ## @brief Returns the record at the specified row number.
00448         def modelByIndex(self, row):
00449                 record = self.recordByIndex( row )
00450                 self.ensureModelLoaded(record)
00451                 return record
00452 
00453         ## @brief Returns the row number of the given record. Note that
00454         # the record must be in the group. Otherwise an exception is risen.
00455         def indexOfRecord(self, record):
00456                 return self.records.index(record)
00457                 
00458         ## @brief Returns the row number of the given id.
00459         # If the id doesn't exist it returns -1.
00460         def indexOfId(self, id):
00461                 i = 0
00462                 for record in self.records:
00463                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00464                                 if record.id == id:
00465                                         return i
00466                         elif record == id:
00467                                 return i
00468                         i += 1
00469                 return -1
00470 
00471         ## @brief Returns True if the given record exists in the group.
00472         def recordExists(self, record):
00473                 return record in self.records
00474 
00475         ## @brief Returns the record with id 'id'. You can use [] instead.
00476         # Note that it will return the record but won't try to load it.
00477         def recordById(self, id):
00478                 for record in self.records:
00479                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00480                                 if record.id == id:
00481                                         return record
00482                         elif record == id:
00483                                 idx = self.records.index( id )
00484                                 record = Record(id, self, parent=self.parent)
00485                                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00486                                 self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00487                                 self.records[idx] = record 
00488                                 return record
00489 
00490         ## @brief Returns a Record object for the given row.
00491         def recordByIndex(self, row):
00492                 record = self.records[row]
00493                 if isinstance( record, Record ):
00494                         return record
00495                 else:
00496                         record = Record(record, self, parent=self.parent)
00497                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordChanged( PyQt_PyObject )'), self.recordChanged )
00498                         self.connect(record,SIGNAL('recordModified( PyQt_PyObject )'),self.recordModified)
00499                         self.records[row] = record
00500                         return record
00501                 
00502 
00503         ## @brief Checks whether the specified record is fully loaded and loads
00504         # it if necessary.
00505         def ensureModelLoaded(self, record):
00506                 self.ensureUpdated()
00507                 # Do not try to load if record is new.
00508                 if not record.id:
00509                         record.createMissingFields()
00510                         return
00511                 if record.isFullyLoaded():
00512                         return
00513 
00514                 c = Rpc.session.context.copy()
00515                 c.update( self.context() )
00516                 ids = self.ids()
00517                 pos = ids.index(record.id) / self.limit
00518 
00519                 queryIds = ids[pos * self.limit: pos * self.limit + self.limit]
00520                 if None in queryIds:
00521                         queryIds.remove( None )
00522 
00523                 missingFields = record.missingFields()
00524 
00525                 # Load only non binary and image fields
00526                 binaries = [x for x in missingFields if self.fields[x]['type'] in ('binary','image')]
00527                 others = list( set(missingFields) - set(binaries) )
00528                 if others:
00529                         values = self.rpc.read(queryIds, others, c)
00530                         if values:
00531                                 for v in values:
00532                                         id = v['id']
00533                                         if 'id' not in others:
00534                                                 del v['id']
00535                                         self.recordById(id).set(v, signal=False)
00536                 if binaries:
00537                         # We set binaries to the special value None so
00538                         # the field will know it hasn't been loaded and thus
00539                         # load data on demand when get() is called.
00540                         data = {}
00541                         for x in binaries:
00542                                 data[x] = None
00543                         for x in queryIds:
00544                                 self.recordById(x).set( data )
00545                 # TODO: Take a look if we need to set default values for new records!
00546                 ## Set defaults
00547                 #if len(new) and len(to_add):
00548                         #values = self.rpc.default_get( to_add, self.context() )
00549                         #for t in to_add:
00550                                 #if t not in values:
00551                                         #values[t] = False
00552                         #for mod in new:
00553                                 #mod.setDefaults(values)
00554 
00555         ## @brief Allows setting the domain for this group of records.
00556         def setDomain(self, value):
00557                 if value == None:
00558                         self._domain = []
00559                 else:
00560                         self._domain = value
00561                 self._allowRecordLoading  = True
00562                 self.updated = False
00563         
00564         ## @brief Returns the current domain.
00565         def domain(self):
00566                 return self._domain
00567 
00568         ## @brief Allows setting a filter for this group of records.
00569         #
00570         # The filter is conatenated to the domain to further restrict the records of
00571         # the group.
00572         def setFilter(self, value):
00573                 if value == None:
00574                         self._filter = []
00575                 else:
00576                         self._filter = value
00577                 self._allowRecordLoading  = True
00578                 self.updated = False
00579         
00580         ## @brief Returns the current filter.
00581         def filter(self):
00582                 return self._filter
00583 
00584         ## @brief Enables or disables record loading. Sometimes it's desired that the record
00585         # won't load anything, as otherwise it would load records, by default.
00586         #
00587         # Calling setFilter() or setDomain() after this function will reallow record loading
00588         # if it's disallowed. If the following sequence happens:
00589         #
00590         # setAllowRecordLoading( False )
00591         # sort( 'name', Qt.Descending )
00592         # setAllowRecordLoading( True )
00593         # 
00594         # When setAllowRecordLoading( True ) is called, the record will be updated with the
00595         # latest sort parameters. That is, sorted by name in descending order.
00596         def setAllowRecordLoading(self, value):
00597                 self._allowRecordLoading  = value
00598                 if not value:
00599                         self.clear()
00600                 else:
00601                         self.update()
00602         
00603         ## @brief Returns whether record loading is enabled or not.
00604         def allowRecordLoading(self):
00605                 return self._allowRecordLoading 
00606 
00607         ## @brief Reload the record group with current selected sort field, order, domain and filter
00608         def update(self):
00609                 # Update context from Rpc.session.context as language
00610                 # (or other settings) might have changed.
00611                 self._context.update(Rpc.session.context)
00612                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(self.resource)
00613                 ## Make it reload again
00614                 self.updated = False
00615                 self.sort( self.toBeSortedField, self.toBeSortedOrder )
00616 
00617         ## @brief Ensures the group is updated.
00618         def ensureUpdated(self):
00619                 if not self._allowRecordLoading:
00620                         return
00621                 if self.updated:
00622                         return
00623                 self.update()
00624 
00625         ## @brief Sorts the group by the given field name.
00626         def sort(self, field, order):
00627                 self.toBeSortedField = field
00628                 self.toBeSortedOrder = order
00629                 if not self._allowRecordLoading:
00630                         return
00631                 if self._sortMode == self.SortAllItems:
00632                         self.sortAll( field, order )
00633                 else:
00634                         self.sortVisible( field, order )
00635 
00636         # Sorts the records in the group using ALL records in the database
00637         def sortAll(self, field, order):
00638                 if self.updated and field == self.sortedField and order == self.sortedOrder:
00639                         return
00640 
00641                 # Check there're no new or modified fields. If there are
00642                 # we won't sort as it means reloading data from the server
00643                 # and we'd loose current changes.
00644                 if self.isModified():
00645                         return
00646 
00647                 if not field in self.fields.keys():
00648                         # If the field doesn't exist use default sorting. Usually this will
00649                         # happen when we update and haven't selected a field to sort by.
00650                         ids = self.rpc.search( self._domain + self._filter, 0, False, False, self._context )
00651                 else:
00652                         type = self.fields[field]['type']
00653                         if type == 'one2many' or type == 'many2many':
00654                                 # We're not able to sort 2many fields
00655                                 return
00656 
00657                         # A lot of the work done here should be done on the server by core OpenERP
00658                         # functions. This means this runs slower than it should due to network and
00659                         # serialization latency. Even more, we lack some information to make it 
00660                         # work well.
00661                         orderby = field + " "
00662                         if order == Qt.AscendingOrder:
00663                                 orderby += "ASC"
00664                         else:
00665                                 orderby += "DESC"
00666                         try:
00667                                 # Use call to catch exceptions
00668                                 ids = Rpc.session.call('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'search', self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, orderby, self._context )
00669                         except:
00670                                 # In functional fields not stored in the database this will
00671                                 # cause an exceptioin :(
00672                                 # Use default order
00673                                 ids = self.rpc.search(self._domain + self._filter, 0, 0, False, self._context )
00674 
00675                 # We set this fields in the end in case some exceptions where fired 
00676                 # in previous steps.
00677                 self.sortedField = field
00678                 self.sortedOrder = order
00679                 self.updated = True
00680 
00681                 self.clear()
00682                 # The load function will be in charge of loading and sorting elements
00683                 self.load( ids )
00684 
00685         # Sorts the records of the group taking into account only loaded fields.
00686         def sortVisible(self, field, order):
00687                 if self.updated and field == self.sortedField and order == self.sortedOrder:
00688                         return
00689 
00690                 if not self.updated:
00691                         ids = self.rpc( self._domain + self._filter, 0, self.limit, False, self._context )
00692                         self.clear()
00693                         self.load( ids )
00694                 
00695                 if not field in self.fields:
00696                         return
00697 
00698                 if field != self.sortedField:
00699                         # Sort only if last sorted field was different than current
00700 
00701                         # We need this function here as we use the 'field' variable
00702                         def ignoreCase(record):
00703                                 v = record.value(field)
00704                                 if isinstance(v, unicode) or isinstance(v, str):
00705                                         return v.lower()
00706                                 else:
00707                                         return v
00708 
00709                         type = self.fields[field]['type']
00710                         if type == 'one2many' or type == 'many2many':
00711                                 self.records.sort( key=lambda x: len(x.value(field).group) )
00712                         else:
00713                                 self.records.sort( key=ignoreCase )
00714                         if order == Qt.DescendingOrder:
00715                                 self.records.reverse()
00716                 else:
00717                         # If we're only reversing the order, then reverse simply reverse
00718                         if order != self.sortedOrder:
00719                                 self.records.reverse()
00720 
00721                 self.sortedField = field
00722                 self.sortedOrder = order
00723                 self.updated = True
00724                 
00725         ## @brief Removes all new records and marks all modified ones as not loaded.
00726         def cancel(self):
00727                 for record in self.records[:]:
00728                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00729                                 if not record.id:
00730                                         self.records.remove( record )
00731                                 elif record.isModified():
00732                                         record.cancel()
00733                         else:
00734                                 if not record:
00735                                         self.records.remove( record )
00736 
00737         ## @brief Returns True if any of the records in the group has been modified.
00738         def isModified(self):
00739                 for record in self.records:
00740                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00741                                 if record.isModified():
00742                                         return True
00743                 return False
00744 
00745         ## @brief Returns True if the given record has been modified.
00746         def isRecordModified(self, id):
00747                 for record in self.records:
00748                         if isinstance( record, Record ):
00749                                 if record.id == id:
00750                                         return record.isModified()
00751                         elif record == id:
00752                                 return False
00753                 return False    
00754 
00755         ## @brief Returns True if the given field is required in the RecordGroup, otherwise returns False.
00756         # Note that this is a flag for the whole group, but each record could have different values depending
00757         # on its state.
00758         def isFieldRequired(self, fieldName):
00759                 required = self.fields[ fieldName ].get('required', False)
00760                 if isinstance(required, bool):
00761                         return required
00762                 if isinstance(required, str) or isinstance(required, unicode):
00763                         if required.lower() == 'true':
00764                                 return True
00765                         if required.lower() == 'false':
00766                                 return False
00767                 return bool(int(required))
00768                 
00769
